name: Avoid using javascript or expression in the CSS file
description: You will have to ensure that URLs only start with "http" not "javascript" and that properties never start with "expression". This rule is compliant with CIS OMG ASCSM-CWE-079 recommendation and OWASP 2013 A3 recommendation.
output:
Line and column for each violation 
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: Ensure your css files will not get data from untrusted source.
sample:
{ background-url : "javascript:alert(1)"; } // and all other URLs 
 { text-size: "expression(alert('XSS'))"; } // only in IE
